dailyPosts.title: Angular Interceptors — The Complete Guide
dailyPosts.description: The Angular interceptor, also known as the HTTP interceptor, is one of my favorite HTTP features in Angular. The reason I like interceptors is that they promote clean code. You write a few lines of code in a single place, and they apply it globally to every HTTP request and response.

dailyPosts.title: Angular Dependency Injection

dailyPosts.title: HostListener + Output =
dailyPosts.description: It was a little surprising to learn that Angular components and directives can listen to custom events published by the Output decorator.
